newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent and gas oil weaker but supports holding.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent and gas oil weaker but supports holding.

text.p: IPE Brent crude and gas oil futures were generally weaker over the morning but supports on both markets were holding fairly well, traders said.
At 1135 GMT, July Brent was trading 13 cents lower at $20.05 a barrel holding stable in a narrow range over the morning after bobbing back from a low of $20.
However, GNI Research said in its daily report that volatility could increase later in the day. The funds could look for higher prices and the trade lower numbers.
"On balance we would not be surprised to see a test of higher levels again, but the push may have to come from New York," GNI said.
The Brent market spent most of the morning bouncing off support around $20 that appeared to be holding well, although traders said there was little volume in the selling.
Gas oil futures showed a similar pattern of trade with support around the $177-$177.25 level holding well, apart from a brief dip to a $176.75 low.
The June contract last traded $1.50 down at $177.50 with July contangoed by around $1.
Traders said talk of run cuts due to poor crack margins was also seen providing some support.
